attributes.description:
Controls the overall height of the top navigation bar (the horizontal header at the top of the page). Acceptable units: px, em, rem, vh.
CSS variable: --wm-top-height

Sets the background color of the top navigation bar (the horizontal header at the top of the page).
CSS variable: --wm-top-background

Controls the drop shadow of the top navigation bar to create depth and separation from page content. Use subtle shadows for a refined look.
CSS variable: --wm-top-box-shadow

Controls the stacking order (z-index) of the top navigation bar relative to other elements. Higher values keep the bar above overlapping content.
CSS variable: --wm-top-z-index

Sets the border color of the top navigation bar. Commonly used for a bottom divider line.
CSS variable: --wm-top-border-color

Controls the border style of the top navigation bar. Allowed values: solid, dashed, dotted, none.
CSS variable: --wm-top-border-style

Controls corner rounding of the top navigation bar. Use higher values for rounded corners.
CSS variable: --wm-top-border-radius

Controls the border thickness of the top navigation bar in the order: top right bottom left. The default adds only a bottom divider line.
CSS variable: --wm-top-border-width
